intro_text: As your patrol is checking the border markings, a o_c_n patrol appears and begins jeering at the c_n patrol.
decline_text: Your patrol decides this isn't worthwhile and backs off from the other patrol, leaving the area.

success_outcomes.text: The patrol remains calm and collected, ignoring the aggression. Eventually the o_c_n patrol gives up on their taunting and leaves the area, deflated by the lack of reaction.

s_c is quick to strike up conversation with the other patrol, trying to get to the root of their rudeness. Eventually the problem is smoothed over, nothing but a misunderstanding and unfounded assumptions.

s_c is quick to strike up conversation with the other patrol, trying to get to the root of their rudeness. Eventually the problem is smoothed over, nothing but a misunderstanding and unfounded assumptions.

fail_outcomes.text: Your patrol jeers right back. After trading insults and threats for a few minutes the two patrols part ways, begrudgingly leaving the area. This experience won't be good for Clan relations.

s_c shuffles their feet, nervous at the appearance of a hostile o_c_n patrol. Suddenly, s_c takes off back towards the camp! The tension is just too much! Their cowardly reaction won't reflect well on the Clan.

The two patrols begin throwing insults back and forth, the tension ratcheting higher and higher until suddenly a fight breaks out! The tussle quickly becomes deadly, r_r lying motionless on the ground when the enemy rabbit backs off.

history_text.scar: m_c was scarred by an enemy warrior.
history_text.reg_death: m_c was killed by an enemy warrior.

fail_outcomes.text: The two patrols begin throwing insults back and forth, the tension ratcheting higher and higher until suddenly a fight breaks out! The tussle ends quickly but r_r is still left injured.

history_text.reg_death: m_c was killed by an enemy warrior.

antag_fail_outcomes.text: Angry at the insult to their Clan, your patrol throws themselves at the enemy patrol. Despite their righteous fury the o_c_n patrol quickly overpowers them and sends your patrol back onto their own side of the border.

antag_success_outcomes.text: Angry at the insult to their Clan, your patrol throws themselves at the enemy patrol. They drive the o_c_n patrol away from the border.

s_c postures right back at the o_c_n cats, drawing themselves up to their full height and baring their teeth. The other patrol backs down a bit, they seem to know of s_c's reputation in battle.  The o_c_n cats eventually leave, cowed by the display but with begrudging respect for s_c's strength.

s_c is quick to strike up conversation with the other patrol, playfully poking fun at both o_c_n and c_n. {PRONOUN/s_c/poss/CAP} antics lighten the mood and make the other patrol cats laugh despite their previous aggression.  Situation successfully diffused and cats on both sides feeling surprisingly friendly toward each other, the two patrols part ways.

s_c won't stand for this insult to their Clan. {PRONOUN/s_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/s_c/throw/throws} {PRONOUN/s_c/self} at the o_c_n patrol, but the enemy patrol has no trouble rebuffing one rabbit. Your patrol backs off from the border.

intro_text: r_r spies a fat rabbit on the other side of the o_c_n border. A tempting opportunity to be sure, but it may not be wise to hunt on an enemy's territory.
decline_text: Your patrol decides that one rabbit isn't worth the potential fight.

success_outcomes.text: r_r pounces without hesitation! {PRONOUN/r_r/subject/CAP} {VERB/r_r/glance/glances} around, rabbit hanging from their muzzle, but it seems there aren't any o_c_n cats nearby. r_r trots back over the border, {PRONOUN/r_r/poss} prize in tow and transgression unnoticed.

r_r leaps for the rabbit! And promptly trips over a rock. The rabbit hops away and r_r sheepishly picks {PRONOUN/r_r/self} up. It's probably for the better that {PRONOUN/r_r/subject} weren't able to catch the rabbit. Trespassing could have easily caused a fight.

s_c leaps for the rabbit, making a swift kill just before a o_c_n patrol comes into view. The o_c_n cats screech at the trespass and rush at your patrol. s_c barely manages to talk them down from a fight, begrudgingly handing over the rabbit, and the patrols part ways without any rabbit getting hurt.

r_r is about to leap for the rabbit before s_c grabs them by the scruff and pulls them back! A moment later, r_r sees the group of o_c_n cats that had just come into view. Good thing s_c stopped them before they could blatantly trespass in full view of the other Clan.

fail_outcomes.text: r_r leaps for the rabbit! And promptly trips over a rock. The rabbit hops away and r_r sheepishly picks {PRONOUN/r_r/self} up before noticing the o_c_n rabbit watching {PRONOUN/r_r/object} from the other side of the border. The other rabbit knows exactly what r_r was intending to do and hisses crossly before turning away, presumably to report the incident to their own leader.

s_c pounces with no hesitation! {PRONOUN/s_c/subject/CAP} easily {VERB/s_c/kill/kills} the rabbit before glancing up and coming face to face with a o_c_n rabbit. s_c is promptly chased back over the border and the other rabbit glares, hissing and spitting, until your patrol leaves the area.

r_r checks the area, it seems to be clear of o_c_n patrols. They leap for the rabbit, easily killing it, but very quickly find that they should've double checked before trespassing. A o_c_n patrol rushes into view from where they were hiding and descends upon r_r, killing them before anyone else can help. Was one rabbit worth this?

history_text.scar: m_c disrespected the border lines and was scarred by an enemy warrior for it.
history_text.reg_death: m_c disrespected the border lines and was killed by an enemy warrior for it.

fail_outcomes.text: r_r pounces with no hesitation! {PRONOUN/r_r/subject/CAP} easily {VERB/r_r/kill/kills} the rabbit before glancing up and coming face to face with a o_c_n rabbit. After a short tussle, r_r flees back over the border and limps their way home; that rabbit certainly wasn't worth the trouble.

history_text.scar: m_c disrespected the border lines and was scarred by an enemy warrior for it.
history_text.reg_death: m_c disrespected the border lines and was killed by an enemy warrior for it.

antag_fail_outcomes.text: r_r leaps for the rabbit! And promptly trips over a rock. The rabbit hops away and r_r sheepishly picks {PRONOUN/r_r/self} up before noticing the o_c_n rabbit watching {PRONOUN/r_r/object} from the other side of the border. The other rabbit laughs at the pathetic display and turns to walk deeper into their own territory. They seem to be unfazed and unimpressed by the sad attempt.

antag_success_outcomes.text: A tempting opportunity. And also a perfect one. r_r pounces and swiftly kills the rabbit, intentionally leaving evidence of their deed behind. That will show those o_c_n cats just how confident c_n is in their own power.

intro_text: p_l pads along, mouth open slightly as they scent for any traces of herbs. Oh! They can smell some raspberries nearby - but it seems that they're just over the border.
decline_text: They decide that trespassing isn't worth it in this case.

success_outcomes.text: They pad over to the border and hesitate only momentarily before crossing. They quickly gather some of the berries, making sure to leave plenty for o_c_n's healer if they need some, too.

They pad to the border and pause for a heartbeat to scent the air. o_c_n's scent is very strong, but there's something else... o_c_n's healer appears at that moment. They're walking towards the raspberries when they spot p_l and curl their lip. They snarl that they're not willing to share with an enemy Clan. p_l takes the hint and leaves.

p_l is about to step over the border when a hiss stops them in their tracks. A o_c_n warrior bounds into view, bristling with rage. They quickly explain that they're the healer and the warrior code allows them to cross the border and assure that they only need a few berries for some sick Clanmates. The warrior looks torn, but agrees to this.

fail_outcomes.text: p_l starts to step over the border but a hiss stops them in their tracks. A o_c_n patrol is running their way. As the patrol approaches, they blurt out that they're a healer. One of the warriors snarls that they won't tolerate c_n cats on their land, healer or not, and p_l needs to leave before they make them. They oblige quickly.

p_l starts to step over the border but a hiss stops them in their tracks. A o_c_n patrol is running their way. As the patrol approaches, they blurt out that they're a healer. The warriors either don't hear them or don't care and they take multiple swipes at the healer before they can get away.

intro_text: As your patrol is checking the border lines, they notice that a o_c_n scent has strayed into their territory. o_c_n has been hostile recently, this can't be good.
decline_text: p_l decides that it isn't important right now. They'll report it when they get back to camp.

success_outcomes.text: After poking around a bit, your patrol discovers a o_c_n rusasi wandering nearby, hopelessly lost. The rusasi is distraught upon discovering they're on the wrong side of the border and while p_l is still suspicious of the situation, they only lecture the rusasi on border lines before sending them back into o_c_n territory.

It doesn't take long to find the o_c_n rusasi that left the scent. The rusasi is aggressive and hostile, but s_c is quick to deescalate the situation. After a gentle conversation, the rusasi begrudgingly apologizes for the trespass.

Your patrol follows the scent and finds a wounded o_c_n warrior. It seems the rabbit had been caught by a dog and chased into c_n territory. The dog is gone now, but the warrior can't make it back across the border on their own. s_c is hesitant, but insists that the patrol at least escort the wounded warrior to the border.

fail_outcomes.text: Your patrol decides to follow the scent, but only ends up walking in circles. Either the trespasser is good at concealing their trail or your patrol just needs to work on their tracking skills. It doesn't matter now, the whole day has been wasted. p_l decides that they should just return to camp and report the strange scent.

s_c is relentless in tracking the scent and at the end of it finds a o_c_n rusasi. The rusasi has a freshly killed rabbit in their mouth and s_c yowls in anger, not hesitating before attacking the rusasi. The o_c_n rabbit is driven off of your territory and the rabbit brought back to camp for your own cats.

Your patrol follows the scent to a o_c_n rabbit taking refuge up a tree. The rabbit looks scared and only stares down at them before a large dog suddenly descends upon your patrol. r_r is killed before they can run and the rest of the patrol scatters in fear.

history_text.scar: m_c followed the scent of a trespassing rabbit and was scarred by a dog.
history_text.reg_death: m_c followed the scent of a trespassing rabbit and was killed by a dog.
history_text.lead_death: followed the scent of a trespassing rabbit and {VERB/m_c/were/was} killed by a dog

history_text.scar: m_c followed the scent of a trespassing rabbit and was scarred by a dog.

Your patrol bounds after the scent, hoping to find the source of it, eventually discovering a limping o_c_n warrior who hastily explains that a dog had chased them into c_n's territory.  The patrol is still angry, but they rein in their hostility and tensely return the rabbit to o_c_n territory.

antag_success_outcomes.text: This is a trespass that will not be tolerated and, frankly, should be reciprocated. Your patrol blatantly spreads their own scent on o_c_n's territory, ruining the clearly marked border lines.

intro_text: r_r heads out into the forest alone, wanting to make a quick check on the border.
decline_text: r_r turns back to camp, deciding that their other duties have to come first.

success_outcomes.text: There's a particular spot where a stream crosses from c_n's forest to o_c_n where the spray from the stream's little tumbling rapids wipes the territory marks particularly quickly. r_r remarks it, and heads home, a simple but necessary mission completed.

r_r comes across a o_c_n rusasi on the wrong side of the border, and holding prey. The youngster is terrified, and loudly protests that they didn't know! r_r gives them the benefit of the doubt and brings them back to the frantic patrol looking for them on the other side of the border, who are formal, but genuinely, grateful.

s_c is marking along the territory line when they encounter a patrol from o_c_n, out on a similar mission. They stare at the other Clan's patrol challengingly, following their every move until the shared border ends. But by the standards of o_c_n - c_n relations, it's a peaceful encounter.

As s_c marks the border, they encounter a o_c_n border patrol. It even includes a young rusasi, who starts fluffing up and insulting them. s_c sternly growls back to the rusasi that border fights are no joke, and surprisingly their mentor joins s_c, both warriors teaching the youngster firmly but peacefully.

fail_outcomes.text: r_r comes across a o_c_n rusasi on the wrong side of the border, and holding prey. They see the rusasi off with a furious swipe of their claws, and then bring the prey back to c_n camp to report the incident to the deputy.

s_c is marking along the territory line when they encounter a patrol from o_c_n, out on a similar mission. They stare at the other Clan's patrol challengingly, following their every move until the shared border ends, and the patrol is marred by muttered insults and hissed threats from both sides.

r_r is having trouble focusing today, and puts a mark in the wrong place - and at the worst possible moment, because a o_c_n patrol sees them doing it! They come back to camp battered and scratched, and immediately apologize to the deputy for the diplomatic incident they've inadvertently caused.

history_text.scar: m_c got injured patrolling on the border.
history_text.reg_death: m_c was killed by a hostile Clan.

fail_outcomes.text: s_c finds a o_c_n patrol out marking the same border, and can't contain their hostility. Eventually the other patrol snaps, and s_c doesn't come back to camp. Their body is found along the border, and o_c_n boasts about it at the next Gathering.

history_text.scar: m_c got injured patrolling on the border.
history_text.reg_death: m_c was killed by a hostile Clan.

fail_outcomes.text: s_c can't contain their hatred for o_c_n, not even meeting a patrol of theirs at the border as a lone rabbit. They come back to camp bleeding.

r_r heads out to clarify a portion of the border that there's been confusion over recently, and encounters the deputy of o_c_n out doing the same thing. They're carefully frosty with each other, but manage to work together to find a solution. Maybe o_c_n isn't as bad as r_r thought.

s_c comes across a patrol from o_c_n, out on a similar mission to them and being led by their deputy. One of the patrol yowls an insult, and s_c squares up, coldly sneering at the warrior that thinks they can take them. The other deputy calls their warrior back, begrudgingly impressed.

As s_c marks the border, they encounter the o_c_n deputy out with their new rusasi. s_c passes on a message from c_n's leader, and politely wishes the young rusasi well. The other deputy is begrudgingly impressed.

decline_text: r_r turns back to camp, deciding that their other duties have to come first.

success_outcomes.text: There's a particular spot where a stream crosses from c_n's forest to o_c_n where the spray from the stream's little tumbling rapids wipes the territory marks particularly quickly. r_r remarks it, and heads home, a simple but necessary mission completed.

r_r heads out to clarify a portion of the border that there's been confusion over recently, and encounters the leader of o_c_n out doing the same thing. They're carefully frosty with each other, but manage to work together to find a solution. Maybe o_c_n isn't as bad as r_r thought.

s_c comes across a patrol from o_c_n, out on a similar mission to them and being led by their Clan leader. One of the patrol yowls an insult, and s_c squares up, coldly sneering at the warrior that thinks they can take them. The other leader calls their warrior back, begrudgingly impressed.

As s_c marks the border, they encounter the o_c_n leader out with their new rusasi. s_c passes on some important information affecting both their Clans, and politely wishes the young rusasi well. The other leader is begrudgingly impressed.

fail_outcomes.text: r_r heads out to clarify a portion of the border that there's been confusion over recently, and encounters the leader of o_c_n out doing the same thing. Both leaders find a point where they can't agree on the right border path, and storm off in a huff.

r_r heads out to clarify a portion of the border that there's been confusion over recently, and encounters the leader of o_c_n out doing the same thing. Both leaders find a point where they can't agree on the right border path, and it descends into a proper fight, claws out between them.

history_text.scar: m_c got injured patrolling on the border.
history_text.reg_death: m_c was killed by a hostile Clan.

fail_outcomes.text: s_c finds a o_c_n patrol out marking the same border, and can't contain their hostility. Eventually the other patrol snaps, and s_c loses a life in a vicious fight. o_c_n boasts about it at the next Gathering.

history_text.scar: m_c got injured patrolling on the border.
history_text.reg_death: m_c was killed by a hostile Clan.

fail_outcomes.text: s_c can't contain their hatred for o_c_n, not even meeting a patrol of theirs at the border as a lone rabbit. They come back to camp bleeding.

history_text.scar: m_c got injured patrolling on the border.
history_text.reg_death: m_c was killed by a hostile Clan.

intro_text: r_r heads out into the grasslands alone, wanting to make a quick check on the border.
decline_text: r_r turns back to camp, deciding that their other duties have to come first.

success_outcomes.text: There's a particular spot where a herd of buffalo have wandered recently along the border with o_c_n, churning the grass into mud and wiping the territorial marks off the map. r_r remarks it, and heads home, a simple but necessary mission completed.

r_r comes across a o_c_n rusasi on the wrong side of the border, and holding prey. The youngster is terrified, and loudly protests that they didn't know! r_r gives them the benefit of the doubt and brings them back to the frantic patrol looking for them on the other side of the border, who are formal, but genuinely, grateful.

s_c is marking along the territory line when they encounter a patrol from o_c_n, out on a similar mission. They stare at the other Clan's patrol challengingly, following their every move until the shared border ends. But by the standards of o_c_n - c_n relations, it's a peaceful encounter.

As s_c marks the border, they encounter a o_c_n border patrol. It even includes a young rusasi, who starts fluffing up and insulting them. s_c sternly growls back to the rusasi that border fights are no joke, and surprisingly their mentor joins s_c, both warriors teaching the youngster firmly but peacefully.

fail_outcomes.text: r_r comes across a o_c_n rusasi on the wrong side of the border, and holding prey. They see the rusasi off with a furious swipe of their claws, and then bring the prey back to c_n camp to report the incident to the deputy.

s_c is marking along the territory line when they encounter a patrol from o_c_n, out on a similar mission. They stare at the other Clan's patrol challengingly, following their every move until the shared border ends, and the patrol is marred by muttered insults and hissed threats from both sides.

r_r is having trouble focusing today, and puts a mark in the wrong place - and at the worst possible moment, because a o_c_n patrol sees them doing it! They come back to camp battered and scratched, and immediately apologize to the deputy for the diplomatic incident they've inadvertently caused.

history_text.scar: m_c got injured patrolling on the border.
history_text.reg_death: m_c was killed by a hostile Clan.

fail_outcomes.text: s_c finds a o_c_n patrol out marking the same border, and can't contain their hostility. Eventually the other patrol snaps, and s_c doesn't come back to camp. Their body is found along the border, and o_c_n boasts about it at the next Gathering.

history_text.scar: m_c got injured patrolling on the border.
history_text.reg_death: m_c was killed by a hostile Clan.

s_c is marking along the territory line when they encounter a patrol from o_c_n, out on a similar mission. They stare at the other Clan's patrol challengingly, following their every move until the shared border ends. But by the standards of o_c_n - c_n relations, it's a peaceful encounter.

fail_outcomes.text: r_r comes across a o_c_n rusasi on the wrong side of the border, and holding prey. Furious, they snarl their anger. The rusasi turns tail and flees, with r_r hot on their trail, and when the rusasi crosses the border to hide behind their mentor the o_c_n warrior's face goes slack with horror to see c_n's deputy.

success_outcomes.text: There's a particular spot where the ground is prone to slipping along the border with o_c_n, dirt falling away from under the trails - not dangerous, but wiping the territorial marks off the map. r_r remarks it, and heads home, a simple but necessary mission completed.

r_r heads out to clarify a portion of the border that there's been confusion over recently, and encounters the leader of o_c_n out doing the same thing. They're carefully frosty with each other, but manage to work together to find a solution. Maybe o_c_n isn't as bad as r_r thought.

s_c comes across a patrol from o_c_n, out on a similar mission to them and being led by their Clan leader. One of the patrol yowls an insult, and s_c squares up, coldly sneering at the warrior that thinks they can take them. The other leader calls their warrior back, begrudgingly impressed.

As s_c marks the border, they encounter the o_c_n leader out with their new rusasi. s_c passes on some important information affecting both their Clans, and politely wishes the young rusasi well. The other leader is begrudgingly impressed.

fail_outcomes.text: r_r heads out to clarify a portion of the border that there's been confusion over recently, and encounters the leader of o_c_n out doing the same thing. Both leaders find a point where they can't agree on the right border path, and storm off in a huff.

r_r heads out to clarify a portion of the border that there's been confusion over recently, and encounters the leader of o_c_n out doing the same thing. Both leaders find a point where they can't agree on the right border path, and it descends into a proper fight, claws out between them.

history_text.scar: m_c got injured patrolling on the border.
history_text.reg_death: m_c was killed by a hostile Clan.

fail_outcomes.text: s_c finds a o_c_n patrol out marking the same border, and can't contain their hostility. Eventually the other patrol snaps, and s_c loses a life in a vicious fight. o_c_n boasts about it at the next Gathering.

history_text.scar: m_c got injured patrolling on the border.
history_text.reg_death: m_c was killed by a hostile Clan.

fail_outcomes.text: s_c can't contain their hatred for o_c_n, not even meeting a patrol of theirs at the border as a lone rabbit. They come back to camp bleeding.

history_text.scar: m_c got injured patrolling on the border.
history_text.reg_death: m_c was killed by a hostile Clan.

intro_text: r_r heads out onto the beach alone to check on the border.
decline_text: r_r turns back to camp, deciding that their other duties have to come first.

success_outcomes.text: The border with o_c_n extends all the way to the coast, with all the pitfalls that come with that. The spray from the ocean has once again wiped away the territorial marks. r_r remarks and heads home, a simple but necessary task completed.

r_r comes across a o_c_n rusasi on the wrong side of the border, and holding prey. The youngster is terrified, and loudly protests that they didn't know! r_r gives them the benefit of the doubt and brings them back to the frantic patrol looking for them on the other side of the border, who are formal, but genuinely, grateful.

s_c is marking along the territory line when they encounter a patrol from o_c_n, out on a similar mission. They stare at the other Clan's patrol challengingly, following their every move until the shared border ends. But by the standards of o_c_n - c_n relations, it's a peaceful encounter.

As s_c marks the border, they encounter a o_c_n border patrol. It even includes a young rusasi, who starts fluffing up and insulting them. s_c sternly growls back to the rusasi that border fights are no joke, and surprisingly their mentor joins s_c, both warriors teaching the youngster firmly but peacefully.

fail_outcomes.text: r_r comes across a o_c_n rusasi on the wrong side of the border, and holding prey. They see the rusasi off with a furious swipe of their claws, and then bring the prey back to c_n camp to report the incident to the deputy.

s_c is marking along the territory line when they encounter a patrol from o_c_n, out on a similar mission. They stare at the other Clan's patrol challengingly, following their every move until the shared border ends, and the patrol is marred by muttered insults and hissed threats from both sides.

r_r is having trouble focusing today, and puts a mark in the wrong place - and at the worst possible moment, because a o_c_n patrol sees them doing it! They come back to camp battered and scratched, and immediately apologize to the deputy for the diplomatic incident they've inadvertently caused.

history_text.scar: m_c got injured patrolling on the border.
history_text.reg_death: m_c was killed by a hostile Clan.

fail_outcomes.text: s_c finds a o_c_n patrol out marking the same border, and can't contain their hostility. Eventually the other patrol snaps, and s_c doesn't come back to camp. Their body is found along the border, and o_c_n boasts about it at the next Gathering.
